column1: whoops, Saifuddin starts with a decent delivery, curving past Gurbaz' defensive poke, but he's over-stepped massively. Free Hit coming up
very full, and he clears the front leg and drills it to mid off. Definite swing for Saifuddin, away from the right hander
curving in dangerously towards Zazai's stumps, and it's defended a little awkwardly to cover
yorker, snaking in to trouble Zazai's toes. Dug out back to the track, Saifuddin hopping across to field off his own bowling
he keeps things tight, on the stumps, and Zazai taps watchfully to leg now
jagging in off the track to beat a big heave into the leg side, stinging Hazratullah's thigh
crunch! Saifuddin finds swing in to the left hander, but the ball lands in the slot and is clubbed over midwicket for the first boundary
outswinger, well wide of off, and he flings a wild drive out, hitting fresh air
Gurbaz gets right across to the off stump, trying to cover the swing, and inside edges onto his body
another outswinger, but it's too far outside off this time and called wide
peach! Gurbaz is undone by a perfect outswinger, angling in and then hooping away outside off to beat a clueless hoick to leg. The swing takes it past the stumps

dropped! Shafiul tests him with a nippy bouncer that is top edged towards fine leg. Mahmudullah is down there, and he settles under it with hands reverse cupped, but the ball bounces straight out. That's a horrible error
big heave to leg from Zazai, but the ball zips past the inside edge of his bat and into the keeper's gloves
on his pads, and it's swatted in the air down to fine leg, dropping well in front of the fielder this time
full, and it's thumped very hard back down the track, the ball clattering into the non-striker's stumps. Would've been four either side of the stumps
a bottom-handed shovel gets a full ball down to fine leg
beaten! Gurbaz is struggling with the swing out there. He plays the line of this one as it angles in, but then is comprehensively beaten as the ball curves away
just short of a good length, and he splices a big shot into space on the leg side
on a length, and it's crunched towards mid on, who dives to stop it, but not cleanly enough to stop a scampered single
uncharacteristically deft touch from Zazai, who waits on one angled across him and dabs it through the gap behind point. He does have proper shots!
fetched! After that orthodox dabbed cut, he follows up with an agricultural swipe into the leg side, the ball taking a thick inside edge and rolling down to fine leg
and straight away he swats a length delivery out to that man at deep midwicket
edged, and runs! Outswinger, just outside off, and Gurbaz pokes his bat out at it, edging down to third man. Slip had been taken out of position, and to be fair he did open the face of the bat
the riposte is a bouncer, Gurbaz pulling out of the stroke as the ball rises past him
very full, and swinging away outside off. Dug out to mid off
slanting across him with the arm, tapped to cover. A touch short, but not punished
awkward, flat-footed poke at a full delivery outside off, and the ball goes nowhere
beaten by another delivery that rushes on with the arm outside off
and again! There's not much spin, but the arm ball is proving effective as Zazai is beaten on the cut now
tapped to mid off, and they chance a quick single
lobbed up, spinning away outside off, and Zazai unleashes a fierce shot through cover
thumped! Zazai backs away, making room, and then smashes a full one back over his head with plenty of bottom hand
and now an ungainly heave into the leg side, the ball spinning past him into the keeper's gloves
cut away in the air towards wide long off, and they're back for the second
attempted sweep, the ball comes off the toe-end and rolls back to the bowler
smeared over midwicket! Homespun technique, but mighty effective. He clears the front leg and swings right across it, getting an excellent connection
down the track he comes, getting right to the pitch and following through with a lofted stroke way over long off
more use of the feet, this time he drives along the ground to long on
crunched to cover, straight at the fielder
too far outside off, and it's called wide, bringing up the fifty for Afghanistan
cut just to the left of the point fielder, and they sprint through for one
Gurbaz dances down at him, Shakib pulling his length back to keep him honest
flashing cut, through gully! Third man is up, and so Zazai seizes on a short, wide one outside off, threading the gap. Placement, rather than power, was key
and he's immediately called upon to field another slashing cut down to third man, just the single this time
angling across him, Gurbaz taps towards point with soft hands and he's called through. A direct hit might have had him, but the throw is well wide
pulled handsomely, didn't bother keeping it down. There's a man out on the boundary, but Zazai was not fussed, rocking back to pull a short one cleanly over his head
big heave, and the ball takes a thick inside edge straight into the turf. Gurbaz is alert to the chance for a quick single
reverse swept into the stands! Gurbaz uses quick feet and strong hands to muscle a reverse sweep well over the boundary
crunched down to long on, just the one
angling in to his pads from around the stumps, tapped softly behind square to hand the strike over
attempted sweep, but the ball bursts past him. Is that a wide? Seems he might have got something on it, it was down the leg side but not called wide, the ball bouncing off Mushfiqur's pads
tapped to cover for a tip-and-run single
big turn! Zazai swings across an offbreak, having exposed his stumps, and it's only the sharp spin on the ball that saves him as it turns past the off stump
another play and a miss, as he tries to fetch one from well wide of off and misses

top edged, and a simple catch! After two misses strokes, he bends down into a sweep but is undone by some turn and bounce. The ball takes the top edge, looping tamely to Mustafizur at short fine leg, and the opening stand is broken
tapped softly to cover, no run

there goes another one! He lasted one ball last night, and two tonight. Asghar sets his sights on a big six down the ground, he gets height but not the required distance, long on getting underneath it and holding on. Two in the over!
full, just outside off, and tapped towards cover to get off the mark
length ball on off, and muscled away to midwicket
edged over the keeper! Length ball outside off, and he goes for a wild slog over midwicket, but it instead flies off the bat's outside
leading edge taken by the bowler running to his right! Length ball on off, and he tried to paddle it square, but the ball flew into the night sky off the bat's face
back of a length outside leg stump, and through to the keeper
blength ball outside leg stump again. Tries to nudge it fine but down the leg side once more
length ball on middle, and fended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, and driven through the cover point region to the man in the deep
good length outside off, and cut in front of square on this occasion
length ball just outside off, and turning away. tapped with soft hands towards the off side
full, just outside off, and he defends away from his body. Flies off his edge to point
full, on middle, and he takes a big stride to play the reverse sweep. Mistimed to point
arm ball, back of a length on middle. Guided off his hips to the leg side
full on middle, and worked into the gap near midwicket
length ball outside off, and punched off the back foot. Flies past the bowler's left as he tries to take a one-handed catch. Gone past him
full, on off, and he tries to defend but the ball holds up, eventually hitting the top-half of the blade. Very nearly goes all the way to the bowler for a catch
pitches outside leg as he tries to reverse sweep. Misses the shot, and the ball rolls away to the off side. Lbw appeal turned down

given this time! Nabi has a chat with his partner before walking off. Full, just outside off and sliding in. Nabi misses the flick, and it hits his front leg. Impact on middle, and this would've crashed into leg stump
full, just outside off, and driven down the ground to long off
length ball on off, and punched to long off for a walking single
walloped! Full, on off, and he golf-swings this over long on

is that a run-out? Mahmudullah with some nifty work. The left-handed nudged this to point for a quick single but the fielder swooped in, and threw the ball under-hand while diving forward. Keeper collects, whips the bails off, and the batsman is short by a few inches
full, just outside off, and he walks across the stumps before guiding one to midwicket
overpitched on leg stump, and he uncomfortably sweeps to short fine leg
length ball, on middle, and flicked to midwicket
full on middle, forcing the batsman to go onto the back foot. Guided to the leg side
full, just outside off, and pushed away to mid-off
shellacked! Full, just outside off, and he gets down on one knee before slog-sweeping it into the crowd
full, just outside off, and driven to wide long off for a single
full, on leg stump. Punched off the back foot to mid-off
full on off, and he backs away to cut in front of square. They take a couple with extra cover cleaning up
full, just outside off, and driven to long off for a single
full, on off, and tapped to point for a quick single
length ball, outside off, and tapped away to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length on off, and he pulls along the ground to deep midwicket
what a delivery! Full, fast and on off stump. Batsman misses the flick, and that's pegged his stumps back
full, just outside off, and driven with the bat's open face to extra cover
nearly a yorker, just outside off, but the batsman manages to dig it back to the bowler
length ball wide outside off, and he hammers a cut to deep point
full, just outside off, and he checks a drive to point. They scamper across for one with Afif taking aim at the stumps
back of a length on middle, and he mistimes a pull to deep backward square
overpitched just outside off, and he mistimes a drive to cover
back of a length on off, and he swings at this ball which is over his head. Connects well, but straight down the throat of Fizz at deep backward square leg
full, on off, and flicked to midwicket. Non-striker wants the single, but the batsman sends him back
yorker on leg, and squirted down to long on for a single
full, just outside off, and he mistimes a drive. Nearly carries to cover, but then beats the fielder. They take a few
full, on middle. Rashid makes room before cracking a shot to the off side. Straight to cover

weird shot from Rashid. Back of a length outside off, and Rashid plays a tennis-ball swat over the bowler's head. Liton Das - at mid off - flies to his right to take a one-handed catch, but it hits his palm and falls into the ground. Dropped
yorker on leg, and squirted down to midwicket
ridiculous! Full, outside off stump, and he gets down on one knee before paddling a shot over short fine leg!
full, just outside off, and whipped away to midwicket from outside the stumps
full, wide outside off, and Rashid walks across the stumps to try and hammer a drive over cover, but misses out completely
full toss wide outside off, and he whips a shot over the infield to the man at deep midwicket
full, on leg stump, and drilled to wide long on for a single
full, just outside off, and he toe-ends a drive over the bowler's head. Doesn't have the pace to run away to the boundary
full, just outside off, and he flat-bats a shot over the bowler's head again. Intercepted by long off

full, just outside leg stump, and he tries to play the reverse paddle. Hits his front leg and Mustafizur appeals for lbw, but not given. Shakib reviews and the replays confirm that it pitched outside leg. They lose their review
full, on middle, and he walks across the stumps before muscling a shot to Mahmudullah at deep backward square leg
full outside leg stump but Shafaq makes room before getting inside the ball's line. Opens the bat's face to drive, and then finds the extra-cover boundary
full, outside leg stump, and he squeezes a shot down to fine leg. Gets two
full toss on leg stump, and the batsman tries to paddle this fine, but it takes a leading edge to point instead
yorker on leg, and Rashid can't do anything except edging on to the leg side. Afghanistan make 138 for 7
floated up outside off, and a watchful drive pings the cover field
Mujeeb loses his line down the leg side, and Bangladesh are on the board
held back a touch, full and outside off. Liton drives towards mid off, and they chance a quick single
beats everyone! Najmul thrusts his hands out into a drive, the ball breaking past him, and Gurbaz is also beaten
a touch short, but the result is a scampered single to cover
Najmul backs away, but Mujeeb follows him. Flicked to leg for another single
flicked off his toes, and out to deep square leg for another single
cracking start, hitting the seam outside off. Liton's feet go absolutely nowhere, and he's beaten on the outside edge
seaming in to him, and Liton punches firmly to cover off the back foot
fuller, and straighter. Liton drives it back at him, Naveen bending low in his follow through to stop it
slower ball, running his fingers over it and landing the ball wide outside off. Liton flings his hands out and edges a drive down to third man
short now, and Najmul rocks back into a swiveled pull into the deep. There's protection for the shot
good finish, Naveen bending his back to extract extra bounce, beating the top edge of Liton's cut outside off
whipped with plenty of bottom hand out to deep midwicket

sliced, skied and caught! Liton backs away, looking to open up the off side, but slices underneath the ball. There's no power in the stroke, and though it goes fairly high, it goes no further than Asghar, in position at mid off, who holds a simple chance
around the wicket comes Mujeeb, cramping Najmul for room with one that goes on with the arm, into him. Tapped to point, and they chance a quick one
flicked wide of mid on, Shakib's off the mark
Najmul gets across to the off side, whipping across his pads to find a single
nudged to mid on, no run
that's not quite as tentative, Najmul jumping out at him to drive, but finding mid on with the shot

slower ball does the trick! Naveen ul Haq has his first wicket in T20I cricket. Najmul was looking to get after him again, but swiped much too early at the ball, chipping it softly into the air on the leg side. It loops tamely towards midwicket, who holds onto a dolly. Big change of pace there, down to 101km/h

direct hit would have been interesting! Shakib aims a big drive at a full one, the ball coming off the inside edge and rolling to leg. They chance a quick single, but Naveen is after it himself, fielding, turning and throwing in a flash. The throw goes just wide ... and Shakib would have been safe anyway. But that was a little tight ...
slower ball, an offcutter, and it bounces a little more than Mushfiqur was expecting. He takes his bottom hand off the bat, fending to leg
top effort at cover! Shakib laces an aerial drive towards Shafiqullah in the covers. He leaps like a salmon to get to it, one handed, but it just doesn't stick. That would have been a blinder
curving in, on a length, and Mushfiqur comes forward to push it into the covers
pushed just wide of mid on, just the single
worked into the leg side, Mushfiqur sends Shakib back
he comes forward now, and gets a leading edge into the covers
attempted reverse sweep, but he fails to put bat to ball. Good take by the keeper
a touch too straight, and he nurdles it into space on the leg side
full, and he drives hard back at the bowler, who lets it through his legs. Mid on scoots round to keep them to one
rising off a good length, and Shakib drives to mid on
straighter this time, but Shakib finds short fine leg with his flick
on his legs once again, and Shakib glances in front of square for one
Janat keeps his line very straight to the right hander too, and he's glanced off the straight to square leg for a single
sweet relief! Shakib leans forward into a lofted straight drive, over the non-striker's head and past a diving mid off fielder

the floodgates open! Back to back boundaries for Shakib, who whips his wrists through a booming drive, on the up, to send the ball flying through cover. He didn't bother keeping it down, but it was in the gap
just short of a good length, outside off, and he opens the face to run it down to third man
fetched from outside off, and down to long on for a single
guided down to third man once again to turn the strike back over
shortish, outside off, but it doesn't get up too high and Shakib pulls off the front foot down to long on
worked into the leg side, tip-and-run single
beaten outside off, the change of pace flummoxing Shakib, whose bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives loosely
flighted, outside off. Mushfiqur gives himself plenty of room and chops a cut just wide of short third man
Nabi switches to around the stumps to Shakib, again giving the ball very generous flight. Shakib drives down to long on
he waits and waits on this one to spin in to him, dabbing a late cut to short third man
floated up very invitingly outside off at just 80km/h, Shakib driving along the turf down to long on
uppish, but safe! Mushfiqur flicks in the air, but finds the gap at midwicket
punched down to long off, Mushfiqur deep in the crease with his weight back
his line is tight on off stump, and Mushfiqur can only defend into the covers
width offered, outside off, but his shot is stopped at point
worked off the pads, into the leg side, for a quick single. Ah, but the return throw is wild, and they're gifted an overthrow
chopped down to third man, just the one
crunch! Gulbadin has to duck for cover as Shakib backs away and slams a powerful straight drive back over his head. Long off is down there, but it's straight of him and racing to the boundary
and now through extra cover! Again Shakib makes room, and clubs a drive on the up, threading the gap at cover. Back to back boundaries raise Bangladesh's fifty
reverse sweep, and it's gloved towards point
Shakib on the charge! He skips out to meet the ball on the full, lofting it elegantly down the ground for his fifth boundary
worked through midwicket for a single

dropped! Mushfiqur skips out now, skying the lofted stroke over the leg side. It went really, really high but Tarakai - on the field as a sub for Rashid - had plenty of time to steady himself underneath it. He fluffs the chance though
cut hard out to the cover sweeper, and they hurry back for two
full, and it's dug out down the ground to raise the fifty partnership
in the crowd! Full, on off, and he uses his bottom-hand to lift a slog over deep midwicket
length ball, just outside off, and guided to third man for a single
length ball on his body, and flicked over the infield to the fielder at deep midwicket
drags a pull into the hands of deep midwicket this time. Another length ball, outside off, and he can't resist the shot. Spliced, and taken in the deep. The batsman is so disappointed...
full just outside off, and he leans into a over drive. Protection in the deep
full, on his toes, and flicked behind square for a single
full, on middle from around the wicket. Comes down the wicket and mistimes to long on
full, on off. Goes deep into his crease and clipped behind square
length ball, just outside off, and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, and cut behind square to the sweeper-fielder in the deep
length ball outside off, and cut to sweeper-cover once more
length ball, and paddled past the keeper's left
length ball, wide-ish outside off. Opens the bat's face and guides it down to third man
length ball, on off, and he walks across the stumps before lofting a paddled shot over short fine leg!
back of a length on off, and he shapes to pull, but deceived by the lack of pace. Through to the keeper on the bounce
full on middle, but going down the leg side this time. Shakib shapes up to paddle, but opts to let it go

full, on leg stump, but going down the leg side. He flicks but misses and this has been taken by the keeper. They appeal for lbw but not given. Afghanistan review and replays show this has clipped his front foot's heel. Impact's on leg stump, but the decision is 'umpire's call' for the wicket since the ball was just clipping the outside of leg stump. Afghanistan retain their review and Shakib will feel lucky to still be in the middle
back of a length, on leg, and he flat-bats a pull to mid-off for a single. But overthrows allow Shakib to get back on strike
back of a length, on off, and he flat-bats a shot past the bowler to the long-on fence
full on middle, but the googly slides down the leg side
whizzes past the outside edge! Full, just outside off and skidding through
full, on middle, and nudged off the back foot to the leg side
length ball on middle, and he tries to cut but under-edges it to short third man instead

he raises his finger! Mahmudullah lost his balance while trying to pull. This was a length ball on off and the googly turned into him. Hits him on the knee-roll and Mahmdullah walks back after a brief discussion with his partner
length ball on off, and the googly has been pushed into the gap near mid-on
length ball on middle, and he makes room to cut. Under-edged to point
back of a length on middle, and angling across. He flat-bats a shot from near his head to mid-on
edged! Length ball, holding it's line outside off, and he tries to guide it fine to third man. But feather-edge instead goes straight into the hands of the wicketkeeper
length ball on leg stump. Angling across the batsman and he opens the bat's face to play a late cut to third man
full, outside leg stump, and going into the keeper's gloves on the bounce
full, just outside leg stump, and flicked to deep midwicket for a couple. Nineteenth T20 fifty for Shakib

excellent from the bowler! Full, very wide outside leg stump, but he knew Shakib would be backing away to make room. The ball goes between bat and body, and taken sharply by the keeper who followed the bowler's line. Could've easily been four byes. Replays show there was an inside-edge to the keeper. Shakib would've been out had they reviewed
full, on off, and he wants to go leg-side before opting to tap a shot to cover for one
full on middle, and he drags a sweep to midwicket
length ball on middle, and defended back
fullish on middle, and he uses the depth of the crease before muscling a shot to deep midwicket
length ball on middle, and flicked away to the leg side
leg stump gone! Full on leg stump, and Afif walks across the stumps to try and play a slog sweep, but the ball doesn't turn into him. Instead goes straight on, and pegs his pole back
full on off, and he attempted front-foot defense takes an inside edge to the leg side
good length on off, and whipped off his waist to deep midwicket
good length on middle, and muscled down to long on
length ball, wide outside off. Turning further away, and cut to short third man. The fielder throws at the bowler's end, and the ricochet off the direct hit allows them to pinch the second run

full, just outside off, and he tries to drive but falls over because he's overbalanced. Keeper whips the bails off and they appeal for the dismissal. Was his back foot in the air? That's the big question. Replays show that the leg was touching the ground when the bails were removed but it was in the air both before and after that moment. Batsman will feel lucky to survive
back of a length ball, just outside off, and he drags a grounded pull to deep midwicket
full, just outside off, and drilled to cover for a quick run
important boundary! Makes room, and places this length ball past the fielder at short third man
length ball on off, and worked away to deep midwicket
good length, outside off, and cut to deep extra cover
full, on leg,and muscled over midwicket! Rashid leaking runs
flat-batted over cow corner! Full, on middle, and swatted over the midwicket fence
drilled to wide long on for a single. Shakib keeps strike. Rashid concedes 18!
good length on middle, and nudged down to third man for a single
slower blal, full on middle, and caressed past the non-striker to long on
short, wide, and he mistimes a cut to point. They scamper across for one
full, outside leg stump, and whipped to midwicket for one
full toss on middle stump, and whipped to deep backward square. Just two more needed
full, just outside off, and lifted over mid-on. They run back for the second and Bangladesh beat Afghanistan for the first time in five years!
